intro: Senecio wardii, commonly known as the orange cup plant, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking orange-yellow flowers that resemble small cups, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Senecio wardii is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
